---

## <span class="iconify" data-icon="material-symbols:description-outline-sharp" data-inline="false"></span> Description
Set a source of your choice to a random position on your canvas without it sticking out the borders.

Regular positioning vs. Move positioning

![Picture](assets/media/random_source_position_default.gif)
![Picture](assets/media/random_source_position_move.gif)

---

## <span class="iconify" data-icon="material-symbols:content-copy-outline-sharp" data-inline="false"></span> Import Code
```

```

---

## <span class="iconify" data-icon="simple-icons:obsstudio" data-inline="false"></span> OBS Move Plugin (optional)
- [Move Plugin](https://obsproject.com/forum/resources/move.913/)
  (If you don't want a smooth animation on the random position, you can skip this)

---

## <span class="iconify" data-icon="tabler:tool" data-inline="false"></span> Setup
1. Copy the import code from above and import the content

    ![Import Actions](assets/media/import_actions.png)

2. Done! ðŸ¥³ 

---

## <span class="iconify" data-icon="material-symbols:settings-alert-rounded" data-inline="false"></span> Settings

- Replace `sceneName` with the name of your scene and `sourceName` with the name of your source
 
  ![Picture](assets/media/random_source_position_settings_1.png)

- Optional: if you have the OBS Move Plugin installed, you can set `moveSource` to `True` and it will then randomly move the source in a fluent animation. You can also set the transition time.

   ![Picture](assets/media/random_source_position_settings_2.png)


- Either assign any trigger you want to the action or use a `Core -> Actions -> Run Action` subaction in a different action to randomize the source's position

---

{: .new }
This action already accounts for (inactive) video sources, positional alignment and horizontal/vertical flipping. Rotation however is not accounted for and may result in glitching out the edges.

---
